de.eckhartarnold.client

Class Slideshow

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.eckhartarnold.client.Slideshow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttachmentListener

    public class Slideshow
extends java.lang.Object
implements AttachmentListener
    Plays a slide show on an ImagePanel.

    The slide show can be stepped through via the show() and next() methods or run automatically via the start() methods.

    Class Slideshow "controls" the slide show, i.e. if a Slideshow object is instantiated, displaying an image should always be done through a call its shod()-method an never by calling the showImage() methods of the image panel directly. Instances of class slide show also register listeners that "listen" to slide show events like starting, stopping, fading and showing of a particular slide.

    Author:
    eckhart

    • Constructor Detail

      • Slideshow

        public Slideshow(ImagePanel imagePanel,
         java.lang.String[] urlList)
        Constructor for class Slideshow. Takes a ImagePanel, where the slide show is to be displayed and a list of image file names as argument.
        Parameters:
        imagePanel - the panel where the slides will be displayed
        urlList - a list of URLs pointing to the images to be displayed

      • Slideshow

        public Slideshow(ImagePanel imagePanel,
         java.lang.String[] names,
         java.lang.String[] directories,
         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,int[][]> sizes)
        Constructor for class Slideshow. Takes a ImagePanel, where the slide show is to be displayed and a list of image names, directory names, where different directories are to contain differently sized versions of the same image and a dictionary that contains information on the image sizes of the different version of each image. The images listed in the names parameter must be contained in each of the directories in a different size, i.e. if the directories are "http://.../640x480" and "http://.../800x600", a version of the same image with a different size should be contained in each of these directories. The images in one directory do not need to be all of the same size, but they may vary in size and aspect ratio. The exact sizes must be contained in the sizes tuple, which contains for each directory a map that associates to each image name the exact size of the image version in the corresponding directory.
        Parameters:
        imagePanel - the panel where the slides will be displayed
        names - a list of image names. Only the base name should be given, not the full URL, i.e. "image.jpg"
        directories - the URLs of one or more directories corresponding to different resolutions.
        sizes - a dictionary that assigns every image name a list of size tuples.

        public void back()
        Show the previous slide. If the slide show was already at the beginning then the last slide if picked again.

        Returns true, if the slide show is running.

      • next

        public void next()
        Show the next slide. If the last slide of the slide show was shown before, then the first slide is displayed again.

      • setLoop

        public void setLoop(boolean enable)
        Enables or disables infinite loops. If enabled, the slide show will not stop automatically after the last slide has been shown. The default value is false.
        Parameters:
        enable - true, if "infinite" repetition of the slide show shall be enabled

      • show

        public void show(int slideNr)
        Shows a specific slide from the list.
        Parameters:
        slideNr - the number of the slide that is shown

      • showImmediately

        public void showImmediately(int slideNr)
        Shows a specific slide without fading in.
        Parameters:
        slideNr - the number of the slide that is to be shown.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts an automatic slide show. The slide show runs from the currently displayed slide (or from the first slide if no slide is displayed currently) to the first slide before the current slide (one round trip!). The delay between the slides is the default value of 5000 ms or, if the start method has been called before with a duration value, the duration the start method was called with last time.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops a currently running slide show. If the slide show was not running nothing happens.
